pullRequest.title: [#2049] Adding AMQP application property "qos" for northbound consumers
pullRequest.bodyText:
I started to implement this and it became a bigger change than I initially thought. Hence I am opening this PR to ask for feedback / guidance 😃 :


In my opinion the right place for the QoS property are the subclasses of ExecutionContext. However the HTTP adapter didn't have one so far (although I found such a class in the code base). Hence I decided to adapt the HTTP adapter to make the adapter implementations more consistent. This is the main reason why the change came out a lot bigger than I thought.


Currently there are 2 QoS enums. I am tempted to refactor this as well, but the change will be bigger then. Hence I thought I will add this in a separate commit (if we agree on it) to make this a bit easier to digest.


The QoS enum I introduced also has a NOT_APPLICABLE (used for TTD and Notification events) and a UNKNOWN level (if a client sends a QoS level we do not know). Do you think we need those cases? What should we do in those cases? Omit the property? Also the validation of the property is not consistent (if I didn't miss something obvious): in the HTTP adapter a request with an unsupported QoS level will be rejected, in the MQTT adapter not as far as I can see.

beforeCommit.message:
[#2049] Adding AMQP application property "qos" for northbound consumers

Adding a new application property "qos" which enables northbound consumers to obtain the QoS level set by the device when it sent a message to a protocol adapter.

This fixes #2049

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

afterCommit.message:
[#2049] Adding AMQP application property "qos" for northbound consumers

This fixes #2049

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

nodes.bodyText: IMHO we should add this method to ExecutionContext because it is a general requirement for all adapters/protocols.

Can you please always use present tense active form? In this case

Gets the quality of service level corresponding to the delivery semantics specified by the device in its request to upload data.

This applies to most (all) of your JavaDoc comments ...

This is done to make the implementation consistent to the other protocol adapters in order to facilitate the implementation of #2049.

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

nodes.bodyText:
This is a new class, thus the date range only contains the date of inception, i.e.

Copyright (c) 2020 Contributors ...

there is no official mapping of numbers to QoS levels. I would therefore suggest to rename this method to fromMqttQosLevel as that is what the number is expected to be, isn't it? And also update the JavaDocs accordingly ...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2016, 2020 Contributors to the Eclipse Foundation
+ *
+ * See the NOTICE file(s) distributed with this work for additional
+ * information regarding copyright ownership.
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the
+ * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
+ *******************************************************************************/
+
+package org.eclipse.hono.util;
+
+/**
+ * Denotes the QoS level with which a message was sent by the device.
+ */
+public enum QoS {
+
+    AT_MOST_ONCE,
+    AT_LEAST_ONCE,
+    /**
+     * Indicates the QoS is not settable by the device.
+     */
+    NOT_APPLICABLE,
+    /**
+     * Indicates that the device set a QoS level which is not known or supported.
+     */
+    UNKNOWN;
+
+    /**
+     * Derive the QoS level from the given number.

nodes.bodyText: this is `EXACTLY_ONCE* delivery semantics. Whether or not it is applicable or supported should be determined by the component using this enum, shouldn't it?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2016, 2020 Contributors to the Eclipse Foundation
+ *
+ * See the NOTICE file(s) distributed with this work for additional
+ * information regarding copyright ownership.
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the
+ * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
+ *******************************************************************************/
+
+package org.eclipse.hono.util;
+
+/**
+ * Denotes the QoS level with which a message was sent by the device.
+ */
+public enum QoS {
+
+    AT_MOST_ONCE,
+    AT_LEAST_ONCE,
+    /**
+     * Indicates the QoS is not settable by the device.
+     */
+    NOT_APPLICABLE,
+    /**
+     * Indicates that the device set a QoS level which is not known or supported.
+     */
+    UNKNOWN;
+
+    /**
+     * Derive the QoS level from the given number.
+     *
+     * @param number The number denoting the QoS level.
+     *
+     * @return The QoS level derived from the given number.
+     */
+    public static QoS from(final int number) {
+        switch (number) {
+            case 0:
+                return AT_MOST_ONCE;
+            case 1:
+                return AT_LEAST_ONCE;
+            case 2:
+                return NOT_APPLICABLE;

nodes.bodyText: we should support AT_MOST_ONCE and EXACTLY_ONCE explicitly here FMPOV
are the public methods supposed to be overridden by subclasses? If not, then either the whole class or the public methods should be final ...

nodes.bodyText:
is qos allowed to be null? If yes, then we should mention it here explicitly

... or {@code null} if unknown.

If not, then we should document this by means of declaring an NPE and also checking for null before starting to process the parameters.
same here, document null value behavior

- * This method simply delegates to {@link #newMessage(ResourceIdentifier, String, String, Buffer, TenantObject, + * This method simply delegates to {@link #newMessage(QoS, ResourceIdentifier, String, String, Buffer, TenantObject, * JsonObject, Integer, Duration)}. * + * @param qos The QoS level with which the device sent the message to the protocol adapter.

commit.message:
[#2049] Using HttpContext in HTTP adapter

This is done to make the implementation consistent to the other protocol adapters in order to facilitate the implementation of #2049.

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>
